description.narrative: To improve access of underserved communities to, and quality of, education in The Gambia, with a particular focus on primary education (lower-basic education) and teacher quality.

condition.narrative: Beginning Year 2 of project, the Recipient shall prepare Service Level Agreements satisfactory to IDA for central and regionaldirectorates of DOSE to be signed by September 1 of each year.
By not later than eight (8) months after Effective Date, the Recipient shall set up the e-centers; and
By not later than two (2) months after the Effective Date, the Recipient shall adopt a revised Project Implementation Manual forthe Project
Provide the financing for the salary incremental of the first cohort of teachers participating in the training program who achievea credit in English and Math on WASSCE Exam
Recruit an internal auditor who will carry out internal control reviews for the Original Project and the Project and performex-post audits and ensure that actions will be taken on reports
Submit memoranda of understanding in form and substance satisfactory to the Association, signed between the MoBSE and MoHERST
The Recipient shall deposit into the Project Account an initial contribution of the equivalent of US$75, 000 by no later thanMarch31, 2007, and every year thereafter by March 1
The Recipient shall submit to IDA before February 15 of each project year, an updated Procurement Plan in form and substancesatisfactory to IDA.

title.narrative: Learners attending literacy courses that have completed 300 hours in (number)

comment.narrative: Target achieved. 2,469 in literacy classes, and 2,370 in post literacy classes (95% are female)

title.narrative: Additional students enrolled in lower- basic education (Grade 1-6) in targeted under-served areas (number)

comment.narrative: Target not yet achieved. The construction of 8 multi-grade schools have been completed. But the construction of basic cycleschools have not yet been completed.The number of students enrolled in multigrade schools and preliminary students registered inthe twobasic cycles is 1622.

title.narrative: Headteachers trained in management and education leadership (number)
Schools collecting data on instructional time on a bi-annual basis (%)

comment.narrative: Target not yet achieved. 16 classroom have been built. This will be met once 2 basic cycle schools (18 classrooms each) are built.

title.narrative: Utility of the learning assessment system
Time spent by cluster monitors in every school within the cluster (Hours per school visit/ visit each school 3 times a month)
Development of a higher education and STI policy (Yes/No)

comment.narrative: Target achieved. Both Higher education policy and STI Policies have been completed and validated.

title.narrative: Development of an operational STI strategy (Yes/No)

comment.narrative: Target achieved. Developed as part of the Medium Term Plan.

title.narrative: System for learning assessment at the primary level
Teachers attending school for at least 18 days on a monthly basis (%)

comment.narrative: Target achieved. Outcomes come from cluster monitors and mobile pilot project from regions 1 and 6

title.narrative: Targeted teachers sitting for the WASSCE (%)

comment.narrative: Target achieved. In 2011, 41 sat for WASSCE (self-sponsored)In 2012, 633 candidates out of the 2400 teachers in the programi.e.506 English (47 private) and 127 Mathematics (32 private).In 2013, 331 sat for WASSCE. Total 1,005 over the course ofproject:42% (total outcome)

title.narrative: Average hours of content delivery in ECSELs during project life (number)

comment.narrative: Not tracked because e-learning centers became available to teachers only recently.

title.narrative: MoBSE with a viable business plan for service provision (yes/no)
Targeted teachers obtaining WASSCE credits in English and/or mathematics (%)

comment.narrative: Target achieved. In 2012, 554 took WASSCE (459 took English and 95 took Math). Among 459 who took English, 69% received credit,andamong 95 who took Math 20 % received credit. They took WASSCE in Sep 2013 and the results will be available in December 2013.

4,839 adult literacy beneficiaries, 529 head teachers, 2,565 teachers in-service face to face program, 5,598 teachers inin-serviceteacher training (original IDA) and 912 education personnel benefited from training at the levels of certificates,bachelor and master's degrees
Target achieved. Average 2400 under AF. 5,598 teachers in in-service teacher training (original IDA)
